notes: Gateway modules with highest fan-in. Any regression here cascades to every other package. Key concerns: struct module bytes handling in types.py, sets.Set removal in utils.py, StringIO/cStringIO unification in string_helpers.py, ConfigParser rename in config_loader.py.
Compatibility shim that may become unnecessary after migration. Review whether it can be removed entirely or simplified.
Binary protocol handling with struct pack/unpack. The bytes/str split is the primary concern. No cross-module dependencies within the cluster.
Largest cluster. Heavy string encoding work, EBCDIC handling, and file I/O. csv_processor and mainframe_parser are the highest-risk individual modules due to encoding complexity.
Database buffer handling and file I/O. Moderate encoding concerns in file_store.
plugin_loader uses imp module (removed in Python 3, must migrate to importlib). script_runner and scheduler have simpler migration paths.
String encoding in email output and web templates. Depends on the broadest set of core modules.
Tests follow their source modules. Main work is updating test framework patterns (unittest2 to pytest) and fixing string assertions for bytes/str split.
Entry-point scripts. Convert last as integration-level validation. setup.py has a CRITICAL distutils blocker requiring migration to setuptools.

global_decisions.decision: Resolved both Phase 0 critical blockers: distutils replaced with setuptools in setup.py, pycrypto replaced with pycryptodome in requirements.txt
global_decisions.rationale: distutils removed in Python 3.12; pycrypto is abandoned with no Py3 support. pycryptodome is the maintained fork with same Crypto namespace.
